intro: Hibbertia cistiflora subsp. cistiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in racemes, often appearing in spring. It is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
